posts.title: Made in Milan
posts.excerpt: Made in Milan is a 1990 short documentary film about fashion designer Giorgio Armani preparing for a show and discusses his ideas about fashion, his family history and the city of Milan it was directed by Martin Scorsese.

posts.title: Himiko
posts.excerpt: Quote: An imagined life of the prehistoric Japanese Queen Himiko, based loosely on a few mentions in Chinese chronicles. Himiko is presented as the head priestess of the Sun Goddess cult and a spirit medium. This cult later was used by the Japanese Imperial family as their claim to rule. Himiko is made queen when …

posts.title: The Ambassador
posts.excerpt: An enigmatic and decadent white diplomat arrives in central Africa sporting dark glasses, riding boots, and a cigarette holder. He has recently bought an ambassadorship and claims to be a do-good rich businessman spearheading a diplomatic mission. Officially, he is there to start a factory that will employ locals to produce matches. Unofficially, he has …

posts._title: Noël Burch – What Do Those Old Films Mean? (1985)
posts.title: What Do Those Old Films Mean?
posts.excerpt: Quote: In this extraordinary six-part series, film historian and critic Noel Burch uses clips of rare archival silent film treasures to take us on a riveting journey of discovery. How did silent film reach such incredible heights in a mere 30 years? Why did film in the United States so quickly become such a popular …

posts._title: Joseph Cedar – Hearat Shulayim aka Footnote (2011)
posts.title: Hearat Shulayim
posts.excerpt: *Nominated for Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film in 2012.*Best Screenplay at Cannes 2011. The story of a great rivalry between a father and son, both eccentric professors in the Talmud department of Hebrew University in Jerusalem. posts.title: Vivre pour vivre
posts.excerpt: The film won the Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film and was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film. Description: Robert Colomb, a famous TV newscaster, is married to Catherine, but is continually unfaithful. posts._title: Claude Lelouch – …pour un maillot jaune AKA For a Yellow Jersey (1965)
posts.title: …pour un maillot jaune
posts.excerpt: The 1965 Tour de France was won by a young Italian called Felice Gimondi, riding only as a late inclusion. The French had hoped that the winner would be Raymond Poulidor relieved for once of riding against Jacques Anquetil who had always beaten him. By the Chartreuse, however, Gimondi was unbeatable and even attacked Poulidor …

posts.title: L’Amour avec des si
posts.excerpt: L’Amour avec des si (1962) SynopsisL’Amour avec des si is a road movie that follows a middle aged man who gives a young woman a lift. posts.title: Avetik
posts.excerpt: “Avetik” is very much in tradition of the cinema of dreams. A gorgeous and mesmerizing film, “Avetik” both thrills the eye and boggles the mind. It takes you on a journey of the mind that leads to heaven or hell – a succulent garden full of bare-breasted goddesses or a frozen step of devastation and …

posts.title: Sunbury Rock Festival
posts.excerpt: The 70’s was a period in Australian Rock Music when the industry’s top acts could also be seen at the annual Sunbury Music Festival. On each Australia Day Weekend from 1972-1975, crowds of 35,000 or more would camp at the picturesque site 30 minutes from Melbourne, anticipating a full rocking of their socks from Australia’s …
